it-was-one-of-those-charles-dickens.text: It was one of those March days when the sun shines hot and the wind blows cold: when it is summer in the light, and winter in the shade.

scratch-a-pessimist-william-beveridge.author: William Beveridge
scratch-a-pessimist-william-beveridge.text: Scratch a pessimist and you find often a defender of privilege.

the-art-of-writing-i-gustave-flaubert.author: Gustave Flaubert
the-art-of-writing-i-gustave-flaubert.text: The art of writing is the art of discovering what you believe.

the-audience-that-i-john-shelby-spong.author: John Shelby Spong
the-audience-that-i-john-shelby-spong.text: The audience that I try to reach are members of what I call the church alumni association. Now they are people who have not found in institutional religion a God big enough to be God for their world.

the-study-of-mathema-charles-caleb-colto.author: Charles Caleb Colton
the-study-of-mathema-charles-caleb-colto.text: The study of mathematics, like the Nile, begins in minuteness but ends in magnificence.

voting-is-the-most-p-hillary-clinton.author: Hillary Clinton
voting-is-the-most-p-hillary-clinton.text: Voting is the most precious right of every citizen, and we have a moral obligation to ensure the integrity of our voting process.

we-are-so-accustomed-francois-de-la-roch.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
we-are-so-accustomed-francois-de-la-roch.text: We are so accustomed to disguise ourselves to others that in the end we become disguised to ourselves.

you-never-know-where-teena-marie.author: Teena Marie
you-never-know-where-teena-marie.text: You never know where a blessing can come from.

camping-is-natures-dave-barry.author: Dave Barry
camping-is-natures-dave-barry.text: Camping is nature's way of promoting the motel business.

courage-is-found-in-j-r-r-tolkien.author: J. R. R. Tolkien
courage-is-found-in-j-r-r-tolkien.text: Courage is found in unlikely places.

hatred-does-not-ceas-buddha.author: Buddha
hatred-does-not-ceas-buddha.text: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.

health-is-the-thing-franklin-pierce-adam.author: Franklin Pierce Adams
health-is-the-thing-franklin-pierce-adam.text: Health is the thing that makes you feel that now is the best time of the year.

lent-is-a-time-to-re-thomas-keating.author: Thomas Keating
lent-is-a-time-to-re-thomas-keating.text: Lent is a time to renew wherever we are in that process that I call the divine therapy. It's a time to look what our instinctual needs are, look at what the dynamics of our unconscious are.

life-isnt-a-matter-rose-kennedy.author: Rose Kennedy
life-isnt-a-matter-rose-kennedy.text: Life isn't a matter of milestones, but of moments.

take-time-for-all-th-benjamin-franklin.author: Benjamin Franklin
take-time-for-all-th-benjamin-franklin.text: Take time for all things: great haste makes great waste.

there-is-a-certain-l-michael-nesmith.author: Michael Nesmith
there-is-a-certain-l-michael-nesmith.text: There is a certain logic to events that pushes you along a certain path. You go along the path that feels the most true, and most according to the principles that are guiding you, and that's the way the decisions are made.

theres-something-ab-elaine-stritch.author: Elaine Stritch
theres-something-ab-elaine-stritch.text: There's something about it that makes sense, Lent. You give something up, and everything's more joyful.

i-dont-try-to-descr-ray-bradbury.author: Ray Bradbury
i-dont-try-to-descr-ray-bradbury.text: I don't try to describe the future. I try to prevent it.

i-never-worry-about-shaquille-o-neal.author: Shaquille O'Neal
i-never-worry-about-shaquille-o-neal.text: I never worry about the problem. I worry about the solution.

life-is-10-percent-w-irving-berlin.author: Irving Berlin
life-is-10-percent-w-irving-berlin.text: Life is 10 percent what you make it, and 90 percent how you take it.

life-is-given-to-us-rabindranath-tagore.author: Rabindranath Tagore
life-is-given-to-us-rabindranath-tagore.text: Life is given to us, we earn it by giving it.

most-ignorance-is-vi-aldous-huxley.author: Aldous Huxley
most-ignorance-is-vi-aldous-huxley.text: Most ignorance is vincible ignorance. We don't know because we don't want to know.

prosperity-tries-the-rose-kennedy.author: Rose Kennedy
prosperity-tries-the-rose-kennedy.text: Prosperity tries the fortunate, adversity the great.

slump-i-aint-in-no-yogi-berra.author: Yogi Berra
slump-i-aint-in-no-yogi-berra.text: Slump? I ain't in no slump... I just ain't hitting.

you-may-drive-out-na-horace.author: Horace
you-may-drive-out-na-horace.text: You may drive out nature with a pitchfork, yet she'll be constantly running back.

a-woman-is-like-a-te-eleanor-roosevelt.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
a-woman-is-like-a-te-eleanor-roosevelt.text: A woman is like a tea bag - you can't tell how strong she is until you put her in hot water.

as-women-we-have-su-merle-dandridge.author: Merle Dandridge
as-women-we-have-su-merle-dandridge.text: As women, we have super powers. We are sisters. We are healers. We are mothers. We are goddess warriors.

because-you-are-wome-amitabh-bachchan.author: Amitabh Bachchan
because-you-are-wome-amitabh-bachchan.text: Because you are women, people will force their thinking on you, their boundaries on you. They will tell you how to dress, how to behave, who you can meet and where you can go. Don't live in the shadows of people's judgement. Make your own choices in the light of your own wisdom.

dont-run-if-you-can-lou-holtz.author: Lou Holtz
dont-run-if-you-can-lou-holtz.text: Don't run if you can walk. Don't walk if you can stand. Don't stand if you can sit. Don't sit if you can lie down.

i-decided-to-start-a-georgia-o-keeffe.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
i-decided-to-start-a-georgia-o-keeffe.text: I decided to start anew, to strip away what I had been taught.

i-hate-smiling-it-m-billie-eilish.author: Billie Eilish
i-hate-smiling-it-m-billie-eilish.text: I hate smiling. It makes me feel weak and powerless and small. I've always been like that; I don't smile in any pictures.

if-you-want-somethin-margaret-thatcher.author: Margaret Thatcher
if-you-want-somethin-margaret-thatcher.text: If you want something said, ask a man; if you want something done, ask a woman.

no-nation-can-rise-t-muhammad-ali-jinnah.author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah
no-nation-can-rise-t-muhammad-ali-jinnah.text: No nation can rise to the height of glory unless your women are side by side with you.

no-struggle-can-ever-muhammad-ali-jinnah.author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah
no-struggle-can-ever-muhammad-ali-jinnah.text: No struggle can ever succeed without women participating side by side with men.

our-government-is-de-john-c-calhoun.author: John C. Calhoun
our-government-is-de-john-c-calhoun.text: Our government is deeply disordered; its credit is impaired; its debt increasing; its expenditures extravagant and wasteful; its disbursements without efficient accountability; and its taxes (for duties are but taxes) enormous, unequal, and oppressive to the great producing classes of the country.

poetry-fettered-fet-william-blake.author: William Blake
poetry-fettered-fet-william-blake.text: Poetry fettered, fetters the human race. Nations are destroyed or flourish in proportion as their poetry, painting, and music are destroyed or flourish.

the-more-i-think-abo-vincent-van-gogh.author: Vincent Van Gogh
the-more-i-think-abo-vincent-van-gogh.text: The more I think about it, the more I realize there is nothing more artistic than to love others.

there-are-two-powers-muhammad-ali-jinnah.author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah
there-are-two-powers-muhammad-ali-jinnah.text: There are two powers in the world; one is the sword and the other is the pen. There is a great competition and rivalry between the two. There is a third power stronger than both, that of the women.

tomorrow-is-only-fou-og-mandino.author: Og Mandino
tomorrow-is-only-fou-og-mandino.text: Tomorrow is only found in the calendar of fools.

we-as-women-we-have-michelle-obama.author: Michelle Obama
we-as-women-we-have-michelle-obama.text: We as women, we have to understand that we know more, just even instinctively, than we think we do.

what-is-art-it-is-t-rabindranath-tagore.author: Rabindranath Tagore
what-is-art-it-is-t-rabindranath-tagore.text: What is Art? It is the response of man's creative soul to the call of the Real.

what-is-called-geniu-henry-david-thoreau.author: Henry David Thoreau
what-is-called-geniu-henry-david-thoreau.text: What is called genius is the abundance of life and health.

women-are-the-larges-hillary-clinton.author: Hillary Clinton
women-are-the-larges-hillary-clinton.text: Women are the largest untapped reservoir of talent in the world.

a-charming-woman-loretta-young.author: Loretta Young
a-charming-woman-loretta-young.text: A charming woman... doesn't follow the crowd. She is herself.

ask-five-economists-edgar-fiedler.author: Edgar Fiedler
ask-five-economists-edgar-fiedler.text: Ask five economists and you'll get five different answers - six if one went to Harvard.

at-eighteen-our-conv-f-scott-fitzgerald.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
at-eighteen-our-conv-f-scott-fitzgerald.text: At eighteen our convictions are hills from which we look; at forty-five they are caves in which we hide.

be-brave-young-love-oscar-hammerstein-ii.author: Oscar Hammerstein II
be-brave-young-love-oscar-hammerstein-ii.text: Be brave, young lovers, and follow your star.

by-working-faithfull-robert-frost.author: Robert Frost
by-working-faithfull-robert-frost.text: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.

courage-is-the-ladde-clare-boothe-luce.author: Clare Boothe Luce
courage-is-the-ladde-clare-boothe-luce.text: Courage is the ladder on which all the other virtues mount.

dont-forget-its-da-david-letterman.author: David Letterman
dont-forget-its-da-david-letterman.text: Don't forget it's daylight savings time. You spring forward, then you fall back. It's like Robert Downey Jr. getting out of bed.

go-to-heaven-for-the-mark-twain.author: Mark Twain
go-to-heaven-for-the-mark-twain.text: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.

he-who-desires-but-william-blake.author: William Blake
he-who-desires-but-william-blake.text: He who desires, but acts not, breeds pestilence.

i-was-taught-that-th-marie-curie.author: Marie Curie
i-was-taught-that-th-marie-curie.text: I was taught that the way of progress was neither swift nor easy.

if-we-could-give-eve-hippocrates.author: Hippocrates
if-we-could-give-eve-hippocrates.text: If we could give every individual the right amount of nourishment and exercise, not too little and not too much, we would have found the safest way to health.

in-my-beginning-is-m-t-s-eliot.author: T. S. Eliot
in-my-beginning-is-m-t-s-eliot.text: In my beginning is my end.

it-is-well-for-the-h-anatole-france.author: Anatole France
it-is-well-for-the-h-anatole-france.text: It is well for the heart to be naive and the mind not to be.

jealousy-is-the-jaun-john-dryden.author: John Dryden
jealousy-is-the-jaun-john-dryden.text: Jealousy is the jaundice of the soul.

leadership-cannot-re-harold-s-geneen.author: Harold S. Geneen
leadership-cannot-re-harold-s-geneen.text: Leadership cannot really be taught. It can only be learned.

life-beats-down-and-stella-adler.author: Stella Adler
life-beats-down-and-stella-adler.text: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.

my-religion-is-very-dalai-lama.author: Dalai Lama
my-religion-is-very-dalai-lama.text: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.

no-difficulty-can-di-ella-wheeler-wilcox.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
no-difficulty-can-di-ella-wheeler-wilcox.text: No difficulty can discourage, no obstacle dismay, no trouble dishearten the man who has acquired the art of being alive. Difficulties are but dares of fate, obstacles but hurdles to try his skill, troubles but bitter tonics to give him strength; and he rises higher and looms greater after each encounter with adversity.

no-one-owns-life-bu-william-s-burroughs.author: William S. Burroughs
no-one-owns-life-bu-william-s-burroughs.text: No one owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death.

of-puns-it-has-been-edgar-allan-poe.author: Edgar Allan Poe
of-puns-it-has-been-edgar-allan-poe.text: Of puns it has been said that those who most dislike them are those who are least able to utter them.

one-who-deceives-wil-niccolo-machiavelli.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
one-who-deceives-wil-niccolo-machiavelli.text: One who deceives will always find those who allow themselves to be deceived.

prejudice-is-sinful-jewell-parker-rhodes.author: Jewell Parker Rhodes
prejudice-is-sinful-jewell-parker-rhodes.text: Prejudice is sinful. All blood flows red. And the most harmful and foolish kind of prejudice is prejudice against yourself. Every woman is your sister, and every woman needs her sisters. So try to give other women the courtesy of your compassion, respect, and forgiveness. Love yourself despite - and because of - your flaws.

surprise-is-the-grea-boris-pasternak.author: Boris Pasternak
surprise-is-the-grea-boris-pasternak.text: Surprise is the greatest gift which life can grant us.

the-best-scientists-sylvia-earle.author: Sylvia Earle
the-best-scientists-sylvia-earle.text: The best scientists and explorers have the attributes of kids! They ask question and have a sense of wonder. They have curiosity. 'Who, what, where, why, when, and how!' They never stop asking questions, and I never stop asking questions, just like a five year old.

the-better-i-get-to-charles-de-gaulle.author: Charles de Gaulle
the-better-i-get-to-charles-de-gaulle.text: The better I get to know men, the more I find myself loving dogs.

the-flower-is-the-po-jean-giraudoux.author: Jean Giraudoux
the-flower-is-the-po-jean-giraudoux.text: The flower is the poetry of reproduction. It is an example of the eternal seductiveness of life.

the-hours-of-folly-a-william-blake.author: William Blake
the-hours-of-folly-a-william-blake.text: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.

there-cannot-be-a-cr-henry-kissinger.author: Henry Kissinger
there-cannot-be-a-cr-henry-kissinger.text: There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full.

there-is-nothing-new-harry-s-truman.author: Harry S Truman
there-is-nothing-new-harry-s-truman.text: There is nothing new in the world except the history you do not know.

those-who-hate-you-d-richard-m-nixon.author: Richard M. Nixon
those-who-hate-you-d-richard-m-nixon.text: Those who hate you don't win unless you hate them, and then you destroy yourself.

we-make-the-world-we-orison-swett-marden.author: Orison Swett Marden
we-make-the-world-we-orison-swett-marden.text: We make the world we live in and shape our own environment.

you-know-its-going-charles-barkley.author: Charles Barkley
you-know-its-going-charles-barkley.text: You know it's going to hell when the best rapper out there is white and the best golfer is black.

you-know-theres-no-ginger-rogers.author: Ginger Rogers
you-know-theres-no-ginger-rogers.text: You know, there's nothing damnable about being a strong woman. The world needs strong women. There are a lot of strong women you do not see who are guiding, helping, mothering strong men. They want to remain unseen. It's kind of nice to be able to play a strong woman who is seen.

a-forest-bird-never-henrik-ibsen.author: Henrik Ibsen
a-forest-bird-never-henrik-ibsen.text: A forest bird never wants a cage.

an-intellectual-is-s-albert-camus.author: Albert Camus
an-intellectual-is-s-albert-camus.text: An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself.

any-dictator-would-a-noam-chomsky.author: Noam Chomsky
any-dictator-would-a-noam-chomsky.text: Any dictator would admire the uniformity and obedience of the U.S. media.

be-true-to-your-work-john-boyle-o-reilly.author: John Boyle O'Reilly
be-true-to-your-work-john-boyle-o-reilly.text: Be true to your work, your word, and your friend.

climate-change-is-a-malcolm-turnbull.author: Malcolm Turnbull
climate-change-is-a-malcolm-turnbull.text: Climate change is a global problem. The planet is warming because of the growing level of greenhouse gas emissions from human activity. If this trend continues, truly catastrophic consequences are likely to ensue from rising sea levels, to reduced water availability, to more heat waves and fires.

fishes-live-in-the-s-william-shakespeare.author: William Shakespeare
fishes-live-in-the-s-william-shakespeare.text: Fishes live in the sea, as men do a-land; the great ones eat up the little ones.

he-who-loves-with-pu-thomas-a-kempis.author: Thomas a Kempis
he-who-loves-with-pu-thomas-a-kempis.text: He who loves with purity considers not the gift of the lover, but the love of the giver.

i-am-going-to-try-to-anne-lamott.author: Anne Lamott
i-am-going-to-try-to-anne-lamott.text: I am going to try to pay attention to the spring. I am going to look around at all the flowers, and look up at the hectic trees. I am going to close my eyes and listen.

i-dont-believe-in-a-marcel-duchamp.author: Marcel Duchamp
i-dont-believe-in-a-marcel-duchamp.text: I don't believe in art. I believe in artists.

if-you-are-cast-in-a-charlotte-bronte.author: Charlotte Bronte
if-you-are-cast-in-a-charlotte-bronte.text: If you are cast in a different mould to the majority, it is no merit of yours: Nature did it.

love-takes-off-masks-james-baldwin.author: James Baldwin
love-takes-off-masks-james-baldwin.text: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.

never-in-the-field-o-winston-churchill.author: Winston Churchill
never-in-the-field-o-winston-churchill.text: Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few.

no-great-art-has-eve-rainer-maria-rilke.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
no-great-art-has-eve-rainer-maria-rilke.text: No great art has ever been made without the artist having known danger.

spring-is-when-you-f-doug-larson.author: Doug Larson
spring-is-when-you-f-doug-larson.text: Spring is when you feel like whistling even with a shoe full of slush.

terrorism-has-no-nat-vladimir-putin.author: Vladimir Putin
terrorism-has-no-nat-vladimir-putin.text: Terrorism has no nationality or religion.

the-lord-is-greater-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
the-lord-is-greater-saint-patrick.text: The Lord is greater than all: I have said enough.

the-true-art-of-memo-samuel-johnson.author: Samuel Johnson
the-true-art-of-memo-samuel-johnson.text: The true art of memory is the art of attention.

this-is-our-history-cory-booker.author: Cory Booker
this-is-our-history-cory-booker.text: This is our history - from the Transcontinental Railroad to the Hoover Dam, to the dredging of our ports and building of our most historic bridges - our American ancestors prioritized growth and investment in our nation's infrastructure.

try-to-keep-your-sou-george-sand.author: George Sand
try-to-keep-your-sou-george-sand.text: Try to keep your soul young and quivering right up to old age.

we-still-do-not-know-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein
we-still-do-not-know-albert-einstein.text: We still do not know one thousandth of one percent of what nature has revealed to us.

before-i-was-humilia-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
before-i-was-humilia-saint-patrick.text: Before I was humiliated I was like a stone that lies in deep mud, and he who is mighty came and in his compassion raised me up and exalted me very high and placed me on the top of the wall.

being-irish-he-had-william-butler-yeats.author: William Butler Yeats
being-irish-he-had-william-butler-yeats.text: Being Irish, he had an abiding sense of tragedy, which sustained him through temporary periods of joy.

christ-beside-me-ch-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
christ-beside-me-ch-saint-patrick.text: Christ beside me, Christ before me, Christ behind me, Christ within me, Christ beneath me, Christ above me.

horse-sense-is-the-t-w-c-fields.author: W. C. Fields
horse-sense-is-the-t-w-c-fields.text: Horse sense is the thing a horse has which keeps it from betting on people.

i-am-patrick-a-sinn-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
i-am-patrick-a-sinn-saint-patrick.text: I am Patrick, a sinner, most uncultivated and least of all the faithful and despised in the eyes of many.

i-have-a-creator-who-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
i-have-a-creator-who-saint-patrick.text: I have a Creator who knew all things, even before they were made - even me, his poor little child.

i-have-vowed-to-my-g-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
i-have-vowed-to-my-g-saint-patrick.text: I have vowed to my God to teach the heathen, though I be despised by some.

i-love-everything-th-oliver-goldsmith.author: Oliver Goldsmith
i-love-everything-th-oliver-goldsmith.text: I love everything that's old, - old friends, old times, old manners, old books, old wine.

i-most-certainly-bel-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
i-most-certainly-bel-saint-patrick.text: I most certainly believe that it is the gift of God that I am what I am. And so I dwell amongst barbarians, a proselyte and an exile, for the love of God.

i-partly-know-why-i-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
i-partly-know-why-i-saint-patrick.text: I partly know why I have not led a perfect life like other believers. But I avow to my Lord, and I do not lie, that from the time when I first knew him, the love of God and the fear of him has grown in me from my youth so that I have, by the power of God, always till now kept the faith.

i-plainly-told-them-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
i-plainly-told-them-saint-patrick.text: I plainly told them, 'Be ye sincerely converted, and with your whole heart, to the Lord our God, for nothing is impossible to Him, that He may today send you food on your road, even until you are satisfied, because He has everywhere abundance.' And, with God's help, it was so done: Behold! A herd of swine appeared in the road before our eyes.

i-say-luck-is-when-a-denzel-washington.author: Denzel Washington
i-say-luck-is-when-a-denzel-washington.text: I say luck is when an opportunity comes along and you're prepared for it.

i-see-the-world-thro-denise-morrison.author: Denise Morrison
i-see-the-world-thro-denise-morrison.text: I see the world through Irish eyes, and they are smiling.

i-was-freeborn-accor-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
i-was-freeborn-accor-saint-patrick.text: I was freeborn according to the flesh; I am born of a father who was a decurion, but I sold my noble rank - I blush not to state it, nor am I sorry - for the profit of others. In short, I am a slave in Christ to a foreign nation for the unspeakable glory of the eternal life which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

if-it-was-raining-so-brendan-behan.author: Brendan Behan
if-it-was-raining-so-brendan-behan.text: If it was raining soup, the Irish would go out with forks.

if-you-cant-tolerat-jeff-bezos.author: Jeff Bezos
if-you-cant-tolerat-jeff-bezos.text: If you can't tolerate critics, don't do anything new or interesting.

it-was-not-any-grace-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
it-was-not-any-grace-saint-patrick.text: It was not any grace in me, but God that put this earnest care into my heart, that I should be one of the hunters or fishers whom long ago God foreshowed would come in the last days.

let-who-will-scoff-a-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
let-who-will-scoff-a-saint-patrick.text: Let who will scoff and revile - I will not remain silent; neither will I conceal the signs and wonders which have been shown to me by the Lord, who knew all things even before the time of this world, many years before, just as they happened.

love-is-never-defeat-pope-john-paul-ii.author: Pope John Paul II
love-is-never-defeat-pope-john-paul-ii.text: Love is never defeated, and I could add, the history of Ireland proves it.

our-hearts-were-drun-george-william-russ.author: George William Russell
our-hearts-were-drun-george-william-russ.text: Our hearts were drunk with a beauty Our eyes could never see.

sufficient-for-me-is-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
sufficient-for-me-is-saint-patrick.text: Sufficient for me is that honour which is not seen of men but is felt in the heart, as faithful is He who hath promised and who never lies.

the-lord-discovered-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
the-lord-discovered-saint-patrick.text: The Lord discovered to me a sense of my unbelief that, though late, I should remember my transgressions and that I should be converted with my whole heart to the Lord my God.

the-lord-opened-the-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
the-lord-opened-the-saint-patrick.text: The Lord opened the understanding of my unbelieving heart, so that I should recall my sins.

the-world-is-not-com-martin-buber.author: Martin Buber
the-world-is-not-com-martin-buber.text: The world is not comprehensible, but it is embraceable: through the embracing of one of its beings.

we-have-always-found-winston-churchill.author: Winston Churchill
we-have-always-found-winston-churchill.text: We have always found the Irish a bit odd. They refuse to be English.

you-gotta-try-your-l-jimmy-dean.author: Jimmy Dean
you-gotta-try-your-l-jimmy-dean.text: You gotta try your luck at least once a day, because you could be going around lucky all day and not even know it.

every-reform-movemen-theodore-roosevelt.author: Theodore Roosevelt
every-reform-movemen-theodore-roosevelt.text: Every reform movement has a lunatic fringe.

if-youre-irish-it-victoria-smurfit.author: Victoria Smurfit
if-youre-irish-it-victoria-smurfit.text: If you're Irish, it doesn't matter where you go - you'll find family.

when-jonathan-winter-robin-williams.author: Robin Williams
when-jonathan-winter-robin-williams.text: When Jonathan Winters died, it was like, 'Oh, man!' I knew he was frail, but I always thought he was going to last longer. I knew him as being really funny, but at the same time, he had a dark side.

better-to-illuminate-thomas-aquinas.author: Thomas Aquinas
better-to-illuminate-thomas-aquinas.text: Better to illuminate than merely to shine, to deliver to others contemplated truths than merely to contemplate.

i-see-that-already-i-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
i-see-that-already-i-saint-patrick.text: I see that already in this present world I am exalted above measure by the Lord. And I was not worthy nor such a one as that he should grant this to me, since I know most surely that poverty and affliction become me better than delights and riches.

i-try-to-be-grateful-james-mc-greevey.author: James McGreevey
i-try-to-be-grateful-james-mc-greevey.text: I try to be grateful for the abundance of the blessings that I have, for the journey that I'm on and to relish each day as a gift.

im-irish-on-st-pat-tamara-tunie.author: Tamara Tunie
im-irish-on-st-pat-tamara-tunie.text: I'm Irish on St. Patrick's Day. I'm Italian on Columbus Day. I'm a New Yorker every day.

one-is-loved-because-paulo-coelho.author: Paulo Coelho
one-is-loved-because-paulo-coelho.text: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.

peace-and-justice-ar-dwight-d-eisenhower.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
peace-and-justice-ar-dwight-d-eisenhower.text: Peace and justice are two sides of the same coin.

you-dont-pay-taxes-chris-rock.author: Chris Rock
you-dont-pay-taxes-chris-rock.text: You don't pay taxes - they take taxes.

democracy-is-the-the-h-l-mencken.author: H. L. Mencken
democracy-is-the-the-h-l-mencken.text: Democracy is the theory that the common people know what they want, and deserve to get it good and hard.

dont-stay-in-bed-u-george-burns.author: George Burns
dont-stay-in-bed-u-george-burns.text: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.

i-favor-the-civil-ri-ronald-reagan.author: Ronald Reagan
i-favor-the-civil-ri-ronald-reagan.text: I favor the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and it must be enforced at gunpoint if necessary.

i-only-seek-in-my-ol-saint-patrick.author: Saint Patrick
i-only-seek-in-my-ol-saint-patrick.text: I only seek in my old age to perfect that which I had not before thoroughly learned in my youth, because my sins were a hindrance to me.

if-we-knew-each-othe-john-churton-collin.author: John Churton Collins
if-we-knew-each-othe-john-churton-collin.text: If we knew each other's secrets, what comforts we should find.

its-hard-to-be-humb-muhammad-ali.author: Muhammad Ali
its-hard-to-be-humb-muhammad-ali.text: It's hard to be humble, when you're as great as I am.

ive-been-performing-dick-dale.author: Dick Dale
ive-been-performing-dick-dale.text: I've been performing since 1955. I'm going to have to keep performing till I die because I'm not going to die in some rocking chair with a big ol' beer belly.

love-is-all-it-give-soren-kierkegaard.author: Soren Kierkegaard
love-is-all-it-give-soren-kierkegaard.text: Love is all, it gives all, and it takes all.

that-though-the-radi-william-wordsworth.author: William Wordsworth
that-though-the-radi-william-wordsworth.text: That though the radiance which was once so bright be now forever taken from my sight. Though nothing can bring back the hour of splendor in the grass, glory in the flower. We will grieve not, rather find strength in what remains behind.

the-ability-to-simpl-hans-hofmann.author: Hans Hofmann
the-ability-to-simpl-hans-hofmann.text: The ability to simplify means to eliminate the unnecessary so that the necessary may speak.

the-benefits-of-educ-sam-houston.author: Sam Houston
the-benefits-of-educ-sam-houston.text: The benefits of education and of useful knowledge, generally diffused through a community, are essential to the preservation of a free government.

we-must-return-to-na-luther-burbank.author: Luther Burbank
we-must-return-to-na-luther-burbank.text: We must return to nature and nature's god.

words-like-nature-alfred-lord-tennyson.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
words-like-nature-alfred-lord-tennyson.text: Words, like nature, half reveal and half conceal the soul within.

a-long-time-ago-whe-laura-ingalls-wilder.author: Laura Ingalls Wilder
a-long-time-ago-whe-laura-ingalls-wilder.text: A long time ago, when all the grandfathers and grandmothers of today were little boys and little girls or very small babies, or perhaps not even born, Pa and Ma and Mary and Laura and Baby Carrie left their little house in the Big Woods of Wisconsin.

a-man-cannot-lay-dow-thomas-hobbes.author: Thomas Hobbes
a-man-cannot-lay-dow-thomas-hobbes.text: A man cannot lay down the right of resisting them that assault him by force, to take away his life.

as-the-twig-is-bent-virgil.author: Virgil
as-the-twig-is-bent-virgil.text: As the twig is bent the tree inclines.

behold-my-friends-sitting-bull.author: Sitting Bull
behold-my-friends-sitting-bull.text: Behold, my friends, the spring is come; the earth has gladly received the embraces of the sun, and we shall soon see the results of their love!

in-my-experience-po-muhammad-yunus.author: Muhammad Yunus
in-my-experience-po-muhammad-yunus.text: In my experience, poor people are the world's greatest entrepreneurs. Every day, they must innovate in order to survive. They remain poor because they do not have the opportunities to turn their creativity into sustainable income.

in-youth-we-learn-i-marie-von-ebner-esch.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach
in-youth-we-learn-i-marie-von-ebner-esch.text: In youth we learn; in age we understand.

man-is-not-made-bett-dorothea-dix.author: Dorothea Dix
man-is-not-made-bett-dorothea-dix.text: Man is not made better by being degraded; he is seldom restrained from crime by harsh measures, except the principle of fear predominates in his character, and then he is never made radically better for its influence.

most-people-have-the-bobby-knight.author: Bobby Knight
most-people-have-the-bobby-knight.text: Most people have the will to win, few have the will to prepare to win.

our-greatest-weaknes-thomas-a-edison.author: Thomas A. Edison
our-greatest-weaknes-thomas-a-edison.text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.

remember-democracy-john-adams.author: John Adams
remember-democracy-john-adams.text: Remember, democracy never lasts long. It soon wastes, exhausts, and murders itself. There never was a democracy yet that did not commit suicide.

spring-is-natures-w-robin-williams.author: Robin Williams
spring-is-natures-w-robin-williams.text: Spring is nature's way of saying, 'Let's party!'

talent-hits-a-target-arthur-schopenhauer.author: Arthur Schopenhauer
talent-hits-a-target-arthur-schopenhauer.text: Talent hits a target no one else can hit; Genius hits a target no one else can see.

the-beautiful-spring-harriet-ann-jacobs.author: Harriet Ann Jacobs
the-beautiful-spring-harriet-ann-jacobs.text: The beautiful spring came; and when Nature resumes her loveliness, the human soul is apt to revive also.

the-most-influential-william-temple.author: William Temple
the-most-influential-william-temple.text: The most influential of all educational factors is the conversation in a child's home.

there-is-no-heresy-o-james-joyce.author: James Joyce
there-is-no-heresy-o-james-joyce.text: There is no heresy or no philosophy which is so abhorrent to the church as a human being.

theres-no-tragedy-i-dwight-d-eisenhower.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
theres-no-tragedy-i-dwight-d-eisenhower.text: There's no tragedy in life like the death of a child. Things never get back to the way they were.

you-always-have-to-r-cyndi-lauper.author: Cyndi Lauper
you-always-have-to-r-cyndi-lauper.text: You always have to remember - no matter what you're told - that God loves all the flowers, even the wild ones that grow on the side of the highway.

you-will-never-find-charles-buxton.author: Charles Buxton
you-will-never-find-charles-buxton.text: You will never find time for anything. If you want time you must make it.

any-time-not-spent-o-torquato-tasso.author: Torquato Tasso
any-time-not-spent-o-torquato-tasso.text: Any time not spent on love is wasted.

expect-to-have-hope-sarah-ban-breathnach.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach
expect-to-have-hope-sarah-ban-breathnach.text: Expect to have hope rekindled. Expect your prayers to be answered in wondrous ways. The dry seasons in life do not last. The spring rains will come again.

from-the-end-spring-pliny-the-elder.author: Pliny the Elder
from-the-end-spring-pliny-the-elder.text: From the end spring new beginnings.

music-comes-from-an-henry-williamson.author: Henry Williamson
music-comes-from-an-henry-williamson.text: Music comes from an icicle as it melts, to live again as spring water.

oaths-are-but-words-samuel-butler.author: Samuel Butler
oaths-are-but-words-samuel-butler.text: Oaths are but words, and words are but wind.

pennies-do-not-come-margaret-thatcher.author: Margaret Thatcher
pennies-do-not-come-margaret-thatcher.text: Pennies do not come from heaven. They have to be earned here on earth.

spring-has-returned-rainer-maria-rilke.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
spring-has-returned-rainer-maria-rilke.text: Spring has returned. The Earth is like a child that knows poems.

the-first-day-of-spr-henry-van-dyke.author: Henry Van Dyke
the-first-day-of-spr-henry-van-dyke.text: The first day of spring is one thing, and the first spring day is another. The difference between them is sometimes as great as a month.

to-hold-a-pen-is-to-voltaire.author: Voltaire
to-hold-a-pen-is-to-voltaire.text: To hold a pen is to be at war.

you-exist-only-in-wh-federico-fellini.author: Federico Fellini
you-exist-only-in-wh-federico-fellini.text: You exist only in what you do.

everything-i-learned-audrey-hepburn.author: Audrey Hepburn
everything-i-learned-audrey-hepburn.text: Everything I learned I learned from the movies.

sadly-its-much-eas-james-lovelock.author: James Lovelock
sadly-its-much-eas-james-lovelock.text: Sadly, it's much easier to create a desert than a forest.

the-day-the-lord-cre-bernard-williams.author: Bernard Williams
the-day-the-lord-cre-bernard-williams.text: The day the Lord created hope was probably the same day he created Spring.

when-we-get-piled-up-thomas-jefferson.author: Thomas Jefferson
when-we-get-piled-up-thomas-jefferson.text: When we get piled upon one another in large cities, as in Europe, we shall become as corrupt as Europe.

who-has-a-harder-fig-thomas-a-kempis.author: Thomas a Kempis
who-has-a-harder-fig-thomas-a-kempis.text: Who has a harder fight than he who is striving to overcome himself.

you-prove-your-worth-jean-paul.author: Jean Paul
you-prove-your-worth-jean-paul.text: You prove your worth with your actions, not with your mouth.

a-drawing-is-simply-paul-klee.author: Paul Klee
a-drawing-is-simply-paul-klee.text: A drawing is simply a line going for a walk.

art-in-itself-is-a-stephen-sondheim.author: Stephen Sondheim
art-in-itself-is-a-stephen-sondheim.text: Art, in itself, is an attempt to bring order out of chaos.

bachelors-know-more-h-l-mencken.author: H. L. Mencken
bachelors-know-more-h-l-mencken.text: Bachelors know more about women than married men; if they didn't they'd be married too.

chase-after-the-trut-clarence-darrow.author: Clarence Darrow
chase-after-the-trut-clarence-darrow.text: Chase after the truth like all hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coat tails.

everybody-wants-to-t-mike-krzyzewski.author: Mike Krzyzewski
everybody-wants-to-t-mike-krzyzewski.text: Everybody wants to take responsibility when you win, but when you fail, all these fingers are pointing.

everyone-can-identif-thomas-kinkade.author: Thomas Kinkade
everyone-can-identif-thomas-kinkade.text: Everyone can identify with a fragrant garden, with beauty of sunset, with the quiet of nature, with a warm and cozy cottage.

everyone-has-noticed-c-s-lewis.author: C. S. Lewis
everyone-has-noticed-c-s-lewis.text: Everyone has noticed how hard it is to turn our thoughts to God when everything is going well with us... While what we call 'our own life' remains agreeable, we will not surrender it to Him. What, then, can God do in our interests but make 'our own life' less agreeable to us, and take away the plausible sources of false happiness?

good-manners-is-the-jonathan-swift.author: Jonathan Swift
good-manners-is-the-jonathan-swift.text: Good manners is the art of making those people easy with whom we converse. Whoever makes the fewest people uneasy is the best bred in the room.

he-who-lives-by-the-edgar-fiedler.author: Edgar Fiedler
he-who-lives-by-the-edgar-fiedler.text: He who lives by the crystal ball soon learns to eat ground glass.

he-who-lives-by-the-ray-dalio.author: Ray Dalio
he-who-lives-by-the-ray-dalio.text: He who lives by the crystal ball will eat shattered glass.

i-asked-a-burmese-wh-robert-mueller.author: Robert Mueller
i-asked-a-burmese-wh-robert-mueller.text: I asked a Burmese why women, after centuries of following their men, now walk ahead. He said there were many unexploded land mines since the war.

if-you-do-not-conque-napoleon-hill.author: Napoleon Hill
if-you-do-not-conque-napoleon-hill.text: If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.

in-fair-weather-prep-thomas-fuller.author: Thomas Fuller
in-fair-weather-prep-thomas-fuller.text: In fair weather prepare for foul.

in-general-pride-is-john-ruskin.author: John Ruskin
in-general-pride-is-john-ruskin.text: In general, pride is at the bottom of all great mistakes.

infuse-your-life-wit-bradley-whitford.author: Bradley Whitford
infuse-your-life-wit-bradley-whitford.text: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.

just-because-everyth-irene-peter.author: Irene Peter
just-because-everyth-irene-peter.text: Just because everything is different doesn't mean anything has changed.

lead-us-not-into-tem-sam-levenson.author: Sam Levenson
lead-us-not-into-tem-sam-levenson.text: Lead us not into temptation. Just tell us where it is; we'll find it.

now-this-is-not-the-winston-churchill.author: Winston Churchill
now-this-is-not-the-winston-churchill.text: Now this is not the end. It is not even the beginning of the end. But it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning.

once-a-musician-alw-roger-taylor.author: Roger Taylor
once-a-musician-alw-roger-taylor.text: Once a musician, always a musician.

sad-things-happen-t-mattie-stepanek.author: Mattie Stepanek
sad-things-happen-t-mattie-stepanek.text: Sad things happen. They do. But we don't need to live sad forever.

sometimes-the-truth-henry-rollins.author: Henry Rollins
sometimes-the-truth-henry-rollins.text: Sometimes the truth hurts. And sometimes it feels real good.

success-is-the-sum-o-robert-collier.author: Robert Collier
success-is-the-sum-o-robert-collier.text: Success is the sum of small efforts - repeated day in and day out.

the-japanese-say-if-lester-cole.author: Lester Cole
the-japanese-say-if-lester-cole.text: The Japanese say, If the flower is to be beautiful, it must be cultivated.

the-man-who-is-swimm-woodrow-wilson.author: Woodrow Wilson
the-man-who-is-swimm-woodrow-wilson.text: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.

there-is-a-fellowshi-robert-louis-steven.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
there-is-a-fellowshi-robert-louis-steven.text: There is a fellowship more quiet even than solitude, and which, rightly understood, is solitude made perfect.

there-is-nothing-lik-victor-hugo.author: Victor Hugo
there-is-nothing-lik-victor-hugo.text: There is nothing like a dream to create the future.

to-love-for-the-sake-alphonse-de-lamarti.author: Alphonse de Lamartine
to-love-for-the-sake-alphonse-de-lamarti.text: To love for the sake of being loved is human, but to love for the sake of loving is angelic.

were-all-victims-of-kevin-spacey.author: Kevin Spacey
were-all-victims-of-kevin-spacey.text: We're all victims of our own hubris at times.

women-like-me-arent-alexandria-ocasio-co.author: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
women-like-me-arent-alexandria-ocasio-co.text: Women like me aren't supposed to run for office.

you-reclaim-your-pow-bryant-h-mc-gill.author: Bryant H. McGill
you-reclaim-your-pow-bryant-h-mc-gill.text: You reclaim your power by loving what you were once taught to hate.

difficulties-are-thi-epictetus.author: Epictetus
difficulties-are-thi-epictetus.text: Difficulties are things that show a person what they are.

dont-cry-because-it-dr-seuss.author: Dr. Seuss
dont-cry-because-it-dr-seuss.text: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.

everything-has-its-w-helen-keller.author: Helen Keller
everything-has-its-w-helen-keller.text: Everything has its wonders, even darkness and silence, and I learn, whatever state I may be in, therein to be content.

he-didnt-even-have-jackie-kennedy.author: Jackie Kennedy
he-didnt-even-have-jackie-kennedy.text: He didn't even have the satisfaction of being killed for civil rights. it had to be some silly little Communist.

hell-hath-no-fury-li-milton-friedman.author: Milton Friedman
hell-hath-no-fury-li-milton-friedman.text: Hell hath no fury like a bureaucrat scorned.

holding-on-to-anger-buddha.author: Buddha
holding-on-to-anger-buddha.text: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.

justice-sir-is-the-daniel-webster.author: Daniel Webster
justice-sir-is-the-daniel-webster.text: Justice, sir, is the great interest of man on earth. It is the ligament which holds civilized beings and civilized nations together.

never-forget-the-thr-h-jackson-brown-jr.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
never-forget-the-thr-h-jackson-brown-jr.text: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love, prayer, and forgiveness.

the-more-i-see-of-de-john-muir.author: John Muir
the-more-i-see-of-de-john-muir.text: The more I see of deer, the more I admire them as mountaineers. They make their way into the heart of the roughest solitudes with smooth reserve of strength, through dense belts of brush and forest encumbered with fallen trees and boulder piles, across canons, roaring streams, and snow-fields, ever showing forth beauty and courage.

the-truth-does-not-c-flannery-o-connor.author: Flannery O'Connor
the-truth-does-not-c-flannery-o-connor.text: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.

whats-right-isnt-a-howard-cosell.author: Howard Cosell
whats-right-isnt-a-howard-cosell.text: What's right isn't always popular. What's popular isn't always right.

anyone-who-has-never-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein
anyone-who-has-never-albert-einstein.text: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.

cruelty-like-every-george-eliot.author: George Eliot
cruelty-like-every-george-eliot.text: Cruelty, like every other vice, requires no motive outside of itself; it only requires opportunity.

give-a-little-love-t-john-ruskin.author: John Ruskin
give-a-little-love-t-john-ruskin.text: Give a little love to a child, and you get a great deal back.

grace-is-not-part-of-pope-francis.author: Pope Francis
grace-is-not-part-of-pope-francis.text: Grace is not part of consciousness; it is the amount of light in our souls, not knowledge nor reason.

i-married-my-best-fr-william-j-clinton.author: William J. Clinton
i-married-my-best-fr-william-j-clinton.text: I married my best friend. I was still in awe after more than four years of being around her at how smart and strong and loving and caring she was. And I really hoped that her choosing me and rejecting my advice to pursue her own career was a decision she would never regret.

silence-is-the-mothe-benjamin-disraeli.author: Benjamin Disraeli
silence-is-the-mothe-benjamin-disraeli.text: Silence is the mother of truth.

a-man-travels-the-wo-george-a-moore.author: George A. Moore
a-man-travels-the-wo-george-a-moore.text: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.

avoid-popularity-it-william-penn.author: William Penn
avoid-popularity-it-william-penn.text: Avoid popularity; it has many snares, and no real benefit.

everyone-is-entitled-daniel-patrick-moyn.author: Daniel Patrick Moynihan
everyone-is-entitled-daniel-patrick-moyn.text: Everyone is entitled to his own opinion, but not his own facts.

government-exists-to-ronald-reagan.author: Ronald Reagan
government-exists-to-ronald-reagan.text: Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves.

i-dont-believe-you-ken-venturi.author: Ken Venturi
i-dont-believe-you-ken-venturi.text: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.

if-an-injury-has-to-niccolo-machiavelli.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
if-an-injury-has-to-niccolo-machiavelli.text: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.

life-is-all-memory-tennessee-williams.author: Tennessee Williams
life-is-all-memory-tennessee-williams.text: Life is all memory, except for the one present moment that goes by you so quickly you hardly catch it going.

life-is-partly-what-tennessee-williams.author: Tennessee Williams
life-is-partly-what-tennessee-williams.text: Life is partly what we make it, and partly what it is made by the friends we choose.

men-are-rather-reaso-alexander-hamilton.author: Alexander Hamilton
men-are-rather-reaso-alexander-hamilton.text: Men are rather reasoning than reasonable animals, for the most part governed by the impulse of passion.

painting-from-nature-paul-cezanne.author: Paul Cezanne
painting-from-nature-paul-cezanne.text: Painting from nature is not copying the object; it is realizing one's sensations.

the-best-way-to-keep-wilson-mizner.author: Wilson Mizner
the-best-way-to-keep-wilson-mizner.text: The best way to keep your friends is not to give them away.

the-continued-existe-jim-fowler.author: Jim Fowler
the-continued-existe-jim-fowler.text: The continued existence of wildlife and wilderness is important to the quality of life of humans.

the-job-of-the-artis-francis-bacon.author: Francis Bacon
the-job-of-the-artis-francis-bacon.text: The job of the artist is always to deepen the mystery.

the-ultimate-inspira-nolan-bushnell.author: Nolan Bushnell
the-ultimate-inspira-nolan-bushnell.text: The ultimate inspiration is the deadline.

we-die-that-may-be-toni-morrison.author: Toni Morrison
we-die-that-may-be-toni-morrison.text: We die. That may be the meaning of life. But we do language. That may be the measure of our lives.

what-is-morality-in-alfred-north-whitehe.author: Alfred North Whitehead
what-is-morality-in-alfred-north-whitehe.text: What is morality in any given time or place? It is what the majority then and there happen to like and immorality is what they dislike.

everything-that-is-b-charles-baudelaire.author: Charles Baudelaire
everything-that-is-b-charles-baudelaire.text: Everything that is beautiful and noble is the product of reason and calculation.

gambling-the-sure-w-wilson-mizner.author: Wilson Mizner
gambling-the-sure-w-wilson-mizner.text: Gambling: The sure way of getting nothing for something.

never-let-a-fool-kis-joey-adams.author: Joey Adams
never-let-a-fool-kis-joey-adams.text: Never let a fool kiss you, or a kiss fool you.

of-all-possessions-a-herodotus.author: Herodotus
of-all-possessions-a-herodotus.text: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.

opening-day-all-you-mary-schmich.author: Mary Schmich
opening-day-all-you-mary-schmich.text: Opening day. All you have to do is say the words and you feel the shutters thrown wide, the room air out, the light pour in. In baseball, no other day is so pure with possibility. No scores yet, no losses, no blame or disappointment. No hangover, at least until the game's over.

age-is-something-tha-billie-burke.author: Billie Burke
age-is-something-tha-billie-burke.text: Age is something that doesn't matter, unless you are a cheese.

baseballs-opening-d-rob-sheffield.author: Rob Sheffield
baseballs-opening-d-rob-sheffield.text: Baseball's Opening Day is full of time-honored traditions: the President throws out the first ball, the Cubs' starting pitcher walks away with a 54.00 ERA, the Royals get mathematically eliminated from the pennant race.

its-unfortunate-and-emma-thompson.author: Emma Thompson
its-unfortunate-and-emma-thompson.text: Its unfortunate and I really wish I wouldn't have to say this, but I really like human beings who have suffered. They're kinder.

miracles-are-not-con-saint-augustine.author: Saint Augustine
miracles-are-not-con-saint-augustine.text: Miracles are not contrary to nature, but only contrary to what we know about nature.

never-put-off-till-t-mark-twain.author: Mark Twain
never-put-off-till-t-mark-twain.text: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do the day after tomorrow.

people-ask-me-what-i-rogers-hornsby.author: Rogers Hornsby
people-ask-me-what-i-rogers-hornsby.text: People ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball. I'll tell you what I do. I stare out the window and wait for spring.

the-more-things-chan-alphonse-karr.author: Alphonse Karr
the-more-things-chan-alphonse-karr.text: The more things change, the more they are the same.

where-there-is-great-willa-cather.author: Willa Cather
where-there-is-great-willa-cather.text: Where there is great love, there are always wishes.

you-always-get-a-spe-joe-di-maggio.author: Joe DiMaggio
you-always-get-a-spe-joe-di-maggio.text: You always get a special kick on opening day, no matter how many you go through. You look forward to it like a birthday party when you're a kid. You think something wonderful is going to happen.

i-asked-a-ref-if-he-jim-valvano.author: Jim Valvano
i-asked-a-ref-if-he-jim-valvano.text: I asked a ref if he could give me a technical foul for thinking bad things about him. He said, of course not. I said, well, I think you stink. And he gave me a technical. You can't trust em.

we-have-all-the-ligh-albert-pike.author: Albert Pike
we-have-all-the-ligh-albert-pike.text: We have all the light we need, we just need to put it in practice.

words-are-of-course-rudyard-kipling.author: Rudyard Kipling
words-are-of-course-rudyard-kipling.text: Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind.

from-now-on-ill-co-bill-watterson.author: Bill Watterson
from-now-on-ill-co-bill-watterson.text: From now on, I'll connect the dots my own way.

love-is-supreme-and-duke-ellington.author: Duke Ellington
love-is-supreme-and-duke-ellington.text: Love is supreme and unconditional; like is nice but limited.

mama-was-my-greatest-stevie-wonder.author: Stevie Wonder
mama-was-my-greatest-stevie-wonder.text: Mama was my greatest teacher, a teacher of compassion, love and fearlessness. If love is sweet as a flower, then my mother is that sweet flower of love.

tact-is-the-ability-abraham-lincoln.author: Abraham Lincoln
tact-is-the-ability-abraham-lincoln.text: Tact is the ability to describe others as they see themselves.

we-are-learning-too-ellsworth-huntington.author: Ellsworth Huntington
we-are-learning-too-ellsworth-huntington.text: We are learning, too, that the love of beauty is one of Nature's greatest healers.

here-cometh-april-ag-charles-lamb.author: Charles Lamb
here-cometh-april-ag-charles-lamb.text: Here cometh April again, and as far as I can see the world hath more fools in it than ever.

it-is-best-to-love-w-william-makepeace-t.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
it-is-best-to-love-w-william-makepeace-t.text: It is best to love wisely, no doubt; but to love foolishly is better than not to be able to love at all.

my-imagination-makes-ursula-k-le-guin.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
my-imagination-makes-ursula-k-le-guin.text: My imagination makes me human and makes me a fool; it gives me all the world, and exiles me from it.

o-wind-if-winter-c-percy-bysshe-shelley.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
o-wind-if-winter-c-percy-bysshe-shelley.text: O, wind, if winter comes, can spring be far behind?

the-first-of-april-i-mark-twain.author: Mark Twain
the-first-of-april-i-mark-twain.text: The first of April is the day we remember what we are the other 364 days of the year.

there-is-no-glory-in-william-cullen-brya.author: William Cullen Bryant
there-is-no-glory-in-william-cullen-brya.text: There is no glory in star or blossom till looked upon by a loving eye; There is no fragrance in April breezes till breathed with joy as they wander by.

when-i-was-about-ten-alan-alda.author: Alan Alda
when-i-was-about-ten-alan-alda.text: When I was about ten years old, I gave my teacher an April Fool's sandwich, which had a dead goldfish in it.

wise-men-speak-becau-plato.author: Plato
wise-men-speak-becau-plato.text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.

if-you-cannot-find-p-marvin-gaye.author: Marvin Gaye
if-you-cannot-find-p-marvin-gaye.text: If you cannot find peace within yourself, you will never find it anywhere else.

its-what-makes-you-marvin-gaye.author: Marvin Gaye
its-what-makes-you-marvin-gaye.text: It's what makes you happy in life, and to pursue it, I think, is brave and a wonderful thing. I don't care what people say. I just want to pursue what makes me happy.

recently-i-was-aske-thomas-j-watson.author: Thomas J. Watson
recently-i-was-aske-thomas-j-watson.text: Recently, I was asked if I was going to fire an employee who made a mistake that cost the company $600,000. No, I replied, I just spent $600,000 training him. Why would I want somebody to hire his experience?

so-much-of-what-is-b-haniel-long.author: Haniel Long
so-much-of-what-is-b-haniel-long.text: So much of what is best in us is bound up in our love of family, that it remains the measure of our stability because it measures our sense of loyalty. All other pacts of love or fear derive from it and are modeled upon it.

success-is-never-fin-john-wooden.author: John Wooden
success-is-never-fin-john-wooden.text: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.

sweet-april-showers-thomas-tusser.author: Thomas Tusser
sweet-april-showers-thomas-tusser.text: Sweet April showers do spring May flowers.

worry-never-robs-tom-leo-buscaglia.author: Leo Buscaglia
worry-never-robs-tom-leo-buscaglia.text: Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, it only saps today of its joy.

you-can-kill-a-revol-fred-hampton.author: Fred Hampton
you-can-kill-a-revol-fred-hampton.text: You can kill a revolutionary but you can never kill the revolution.

flattery-is-all-righ-adlai-stevenson-i.author: Adlai Stevenson I
flattery-is-all-righ-adlai-stevenson-i.text: Flattery is all right so long as you don't inhale.

in-the-name-of-the-c-sam-houston.author: Sam Houston
in-the-name-of-the-c-sam-houston.text: In the name of the constitution of Texas, which has been trampled upon, I refuse to take this oath. I love Texas too well to bring civil strife and bloodshed upon her.

i-think-ive-got-a-r-marvin-gaye.author: Marvin Gaye
i-think-ive-got-a-r-marvin-gaye.text: I think I've got a real love thing going. I love people, I love life, and I love nature, and I can't see why other people can't be like that.

in-heaven-all-the-i-friedrich-nietzsche.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
in-heaven-all-the-i-friedrich-nietzsche.text: In heaven, all the interesting people are missing.

one-of-the-greatest-washington-irving.author: Washington Irving
one-of-the-greatest-washington-irving.text: One of the greatest and simplest tools for learning more and growing is doing more.

set-your-course-by-t-omar-n-bradley.author: Omar N. Bradley
set-your-course-by-t-omar-n-bradley.text: Set your course by the stars, not by the lights of every passing ship.

a-doctor-can-bury-hi-frank-lloyd-wright.author: Frank Lloyd Wright
a-doctor-can-bury-hi-frank-lloyd-wright.text: A doctor can bury his mistakes but an architect can only advise his clients to plant vines.

heaven-grant-us-pati-rudyard-kipling.author: Rudyard Kipling
heaven-grant-us-pati-rudyard-kipling.text: Heaven grant us patience with a man in love.

irresponsibility-is-james-joyce.author: James Joyce
irresponsibility-is-james-joyce.text: Irresponsibility is part of the pleasure of all art; it is the part the schools cannot recognize.

housework-cant-kill-phyllis-diller.author: Phyllis Diller
housework-cant-kill-phyllis-diller.text: Housework can't kill you, but why take a chance?

if-youre-going-thro-winston-churchill.author: Winston Churchill
if-youre-going-thro-winston-churchill.text: If you're going through hell, keep going.

poetry-is-a-way-of-t-robert-frost.author: Robert Frost
poetry-is-a-way-of-t-robert-frost.text: Poetry is a way of taking life by the throat.

there-is-always-room-daniel-webster.author: Daniel Webster
there-is-always-room-daniel-webster.text: There is always room at the top.

they-always-say-time-andy-warhol.author: Andy Warhol
they-always-say-time-andy-warhol.text: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

a-word-to-the-wise-i-hunter-s-thompson.author: Hunter S. Thompson
a-word-to-the-wise-i-hunter-s-thompson.text: A word to the wise is infuriating.

dont-threaten-me-wi-billie-holiday.author: Billie Holiday
dont-threaten-me-wi-billie-holiday.text: Don't threaten me with love, baby. Let's just go walking in the rain.

everything-in-life-i-e-b-white.author: E. B. White
everything-in-life-i-e-b-white.text: Everything in life is somewhere else, and you get there in a car.

i-bought-some-instan-steven-wright.author: Steven Wright
i-bought-some-instan-steven-wright.text: I bought some instant water one time but I didn't know what to add to it.

if-a-cluttered-desk-laurence-j-peter.author: Laurence J. Peter
if-a-cluttered-desk-laurence-j-peter.text: If a cluttered desk is the sign of a cluttered mind, what is the significance of a clean desk?

if-god-did-not-inten-john-cleese.author: John Cleese
if-god-did-not-inten-john-cleese.text: If God did not intend for us to eat animals, then why did he make them out of meat?

let-us-put-our-minds-sitting-bull.author: Sitting Bull
let-us-put-our-minds-sitting-bull.text: Let us put our minds together and see what life we can make for our children.

life-is-so-construct-charlotte-bronte.author: Charlotte Bronte
life-is-so-construct-charlotte-bronte.text: Life is so constructed, that the event does not, cannot, will not, match the expectation.

nobody-has-ever-meas-zelda-fitzgerald.author: Zelda Fitzgerald
nobody-has-ever-meas-zelda-fitzgerald.text: Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold.

nothing-we-do-howev-reinhold-niebuhr.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
nothing-we-do-howev-reinhold-niebuhr.text: Nothing we do, however virtuous, can be accomplished alone; therefore we are saved by love.

one-way-to-get-the-m-william-feather.author: William Feather
one-way-to-get-the-m-william-feather.text: One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure.

the-most-effective-w-amelia-earhart.author: Amelia Earhart
the-most-effective-w-amelia-earhart.text: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.

the-physician-can-bu-frank-lloyd-wright.author: Frank Lloyd Wright
the-physician-can-bu-frank-lloyd-wright.text: The physician can bury his mistakes, but the architect can only advise his client to plant vines - so they should go as far as possible from home to build their first buildings.

the-tragedy-of-life-heywood-broun.author: Heywood Broun
the-tragedy-of-life-heywood-broun.text: The tragedy of life is not that man loses but that he almost wins.

to-be-able-to-look-b-khalil-gibran.author: Khalil Gibran
to-be-able-to-look-b-khalil-gibran.text: To be able to look back upon ones life in satisfaction, is to live twice.

we-are-going-to-have-dwight-d-eisenhower.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
we-are-going-to-have-dwight-d-eisenhower.text: We are going to have peace even if we have to fight for it.

when-you-have-to-kil-winston-churchill.author: Winston Churchill
when-you-have-to-kil-winston-churchill.text: When you have to kill a man, it costs nothing to be polite.

you-can-always-count-winston-churchill.author: Winston Churchill
you-can-always-count-winston-churchill.text: You can always count on Americans to do the right thing - after they've tried everything else.

you-cant-blame-thin-tony-evans.author: Tony Evans
you-cant-blame-thin-tony-evans.text: You can't blame things for being dark if the light bulbs aren't working. So we're complaining about the darkness when the bulbs aren't working, and the Bible says that we are the light of the world.

a-man-is-already-hal-brendan-behan.author: Brendan Behan
a-man-is-already-hal-brendan-behan.text: A man is already halfway in love with any woman who listens to him.

cherish-all-your-hap-booth-tarkington.author: Booth Tarkington
cherish-all-your-hap-booth-tarkington.text: Cherish all your happy moments; they make a fine cushion for old age.

every-charitable-act-henry-ward-beecher.author: Henry Ward Beecher
every-charitable-act-henry-ward-beecher.text: Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven.

find-something-your-julia-child.author: Julia Child
find-something-your-julia-child.text: Find something you're passionate about and keep tremendously interested in it.

great-art-picks-up-w-marc-chagall.author: Marc Chagall
great-art-picks-up-w-marc-chagall.text: Great art picks up where nature ends.

i-believe-in-rules-leo-durocher.author: Leo Durocher
i-believe-in-rules-leo-durocher.text: I believe in rules. Sure I do. If there weren't any rules, how could you break them?

men-are-like-the-sta-jose-marti.author: Jose Marti
men-are-like-the-sta-jose-marti.text: Men are like the stars; some generate their own light while others reflect the brilliance they receive.

the-present-time-has-charles-caleb-colto.author: Charles Caleb Colton
the-present-time-has-charles-caleb-colto.text: The present time has one advantage over every other - it is our own.

what-happened-in-the-william-glasser.author: William Glasser
what-happened-in-the-william-glasser.text: What happened in the past that was painful has a great deal to do with what we are today, but revisiting this painful past can contribute little or nothing to what we need to do now.

a-womans-perfume-te-christian-dior.author: Christian Dior
a-womans-perfume-te-christian-dior.text: A woman's perfume tells more about her than her handwriting.

all-change-is-not-gr-ellen-glasgow.author: Ellen Glasgow
all-change-is-not-gr-ellen-glasgow.text: All change is not growth, as all movement is not forward.

french-is-the-langua-stephen-king.author: Stephen King
french-is-the-langua-stephen-king.text: French is the language that turns dirt into romance.

i-dont-paint-things-henri-matisse.author: Henri Matisse
i-dont-paint-things-henri-matisse.text: I don't paint things. I only paint the difference between things.

i-used-to-jog-but-th-david-lee-roth.author: David Lee Roth
i-used-to-jog-but-th-david-lee-roth.text: I used to jog but the ice cubes kept falling out of my glass.

love-sought-is-good-william-shakespeare.author: William Shakespeare
love-sought-is-good-william-shakespeare.text: Love sought is good, but given unsought, is better.

progress-lies-not-in-khalil-gibran.author: Khalil Gibran
progress-lies-not-in-khalil-gibran.text: Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.

serious-sport-has-no-george-orwell.author: George Orwell
serious-sport-has-no-george-orwell.text: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.

we-are-no-longer-hap-walter-savage-lando.author: Walter Savage Landor
we-are-no-longer-hap-walter-savage-lando.text: We are no longer happy so soon as we wish to be happier.

art-is-not-living-i-audre-lorde.author: Audre Lorde
art-is-not-living-i-audre-lorde.text: Art is not living. It is the use of living.

truth-exists-only-l-georges-braque.author: Georges Braque
truth-exists-only-l-georges-braque.text: Truth exists; only lies are invented.

what-happens-is-not-ellen-glasgow.author: Ellen Glasgow
what-happens-is-not-ellen-glasgow.text: What happens is not as important as how you react to what happens.

a-people-free-to-cho-ronald-reagan.author: Ronald Reagan
a-people-free-to-cho-ronald-reagan.text: A people free to choose will always choose peace.

a-rock-pile-ceases-t-antoine-de-saint-ex.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
a-rock-pile-ceases-t-antoine-de-saint-ex.text: A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral.

all-the-art-of-livin-havelock-ellis.author: Havelock Ellis
all-the-art-of-livin-havelock-ellis.text: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.

architecture-has-rec-victor-hugo.author: Victor Hugo
architecture-has-rec-victor-hugo.text: Architecture has recorded the great ideas of the human race. Not only every religious symbol, but every human thought has its page in that vast book.

doing-nothing-is-ver-leslie-nielsen.author: Leslie Nielsen
doing-nothing-is-ver-leslie-nielsen.text: Doing nothing is very hard to do... you never know when you're finished.

great-nations-write-john-ruskin.author: John Ruskin
great-nations-write-john-ruskin.text: Great nations write their autobiographies in three manuscripts - the book of their deeds, the book of their words and the book of their art.

hockey-is-a-sport-fo-tiger-woods.author: Tiger Woods
hockey-is-a-sport-fo-tiger-woods.text: Hockey is a sport for white men. Basketball is a sport for black men. Golf is a sport for white men dressed like black pimps.

i-never-weary-of-gre-robert-louis-steven.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
i-never-weary-of-gre-robert-louis-steven.text: I never weary of great churches. It is my favorite kind of mountain scenery. Mankind was never so happily inspired as when it made a cathedral.

im-spending-a-year-douglas-adams.author: Douglas Adams
im-spending-a-year-douglas-adams.text: I'm spending a year dead for tax reasons.

in-this-world-nothin-benjamin-franklin.author: Benjamin Franklin
in-this-world-nothin-benjamin-franklin.text: In this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes.

innovation-distingui-steve-jobs.author: Steve Jobs
innovation-distingui-steve-jobs.text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.

never-retreat-never-benjamin-jowett.author: Benjamin Jowett
never-retreat-never-benjamin-jowett.text: Never retreat. Never explain. Get it done and let them howl.

our-government-te-louis-d-brandeis.author: Louis D. Brandeis
our-government-te-louis-d-brandeis.text: Our government... teaches the whole people by its example. If the government becomes the lawbreaker, it breeds contempt for law; it invites every man to become a law unto himself; it invites anarchy.

people-dont-underst-tiger-woods.author: Tiger Woods
people-dont-underst-tiger-woods.text: People don't understand that when I grew up, I was never the most talented. I was never the biggest. I was never the fastest. I certainly was never the strongest. The only thing I had was my work ethic, and that's been what has gotten me this far.

republicans-believe-ronald-reagan.author: Ronald Reagan
republicans-believe-ronald-reagan.text: Republicans believe every day is the Fourth of July, but the democrats believe every day is April 15.

the-glow-of-one-warm-thomas-jefferson.author: Thomas Jefferson
the-glow-of-one-warm-thomas-jefferson.text: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.

the-greatest-pleasur-euripides.author: Euripides
the-greatest-pleasur-euripides.text: The greatest pleasure of life is love.

theres-no-sense-in-tiger-woods.author: Tiger Woods
theres-no-sense-in-tiger-woods.text: There's no sense in going to a tournament if you don't believe that you can win it. And that is the belief I have always had. And that is not going to change.

walking-at-random-th-bayard-taylor.author: Bayard Taylor
walking-at-random-th-bayard-taylor.text: Walking at random through the streets, we came by chance upon the Cathedral of Notre Dame. I shall long remember my first impression of the scene within. The lofty gothic ceiling arched far above my head and through the stained windows the light came but dimly - it was all still, solemn and religious.

we-are-an-impossibil-ray-bradbury.author: Ray Bradbury
we-are-an-impossibil-ray-bradbury.text: We are an impossibility in an impossible universe.

we-have-a-system-tha-milton-friedman.author: Milton Friedman
we-have-a-system-tha-milton-friedman.text: We have a system that increasingly taxes work and subsidizes nonwork.

early-to-rise-and-ea-james-thurber.author: James Thurber
early-to-rise-and-ea-james-thurber.text: Early to rise and early to bed makes a man healthy, wealthy, and dead.

the-hardest-thing-to-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein
the-hardest-thing-to-albert-einstein.text: The hardest thing to understand in the world is the income tax.

what-the-world-reall-pearl-bailey.author: Pearl Bailey
what-the-world-reall-pearl-bailey.text: What the world really needs is more love and less paper work.

you-dont-go-to-notr-lou-holtz.author: Lou Holtz
you-dont-go-to-notr-lou-holtz.text: You don't go to Notre Dame to learn something; you go to Notre Dame to be somebody.

you-may-be-deceived-frank-crane.author: Frank Crane
you-may-be-deceived-frank-crane.text: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you don't trust enough.

a-penny-saved-is-a-p-benjamin-franklin.author: Benjamin Franklin
a-penny-saved-is-a-p-benjamin-franklin.text: A penny saved is a penny earned.

a-work-of-art-is-a-w-hans-hofmann.author: Hans Hofmann
a-work-of-art-is-a-w-hans-hofmann.text: A work of art is a world in itself reflecting senses and emotions of the artist's world.

education-must-not-s-w-e-b-du-bois.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
education-must-not-s-w-e-b-du-bois.text: Education must not simply teach work - it must teach Life.

if-people-sat-outsid-bill-watterson.author: Bill Watterson
if-people-sat-outsid-bill-watterson.text: If people sat outside and looked at the stars each night, I'll bet they'd live a lot differently.

in-politics-stupidit-napoleon-bonaparte.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
in-politics-stupidit-napoleon-bonaparte.text: In politics stupidity is not a handicap.

nature-is-often-hidd-francis-bacon.author: Francis Bacon
nature-is-often-hidd-francis-bacon.text: Nature is often hidden, sometimes overcome, seldom extinguished.

the-best-proof-of-lo-joyce-brothers.author: Joyce Brothers
the-best-proof-of-lo-joyce-brothers.text: The best proof of love is trust.

there-are-no-lines-i-edouard-manet.author: Edouard Manet
there-are-no-lines-i-edouard-manet.text: There are no lines in nature, only areas of colour, one against another.

to-me-we-are-the-mo-nina-simone.author: Nina Simone
to-me-we-are-the-mo-nina-simone.text: To me, we are the most beautiful creatures in the whole world. Black people. And I mean that in every sense.

be-extremely-subtle-sun-tzu.author: Sun Tzu
be-extremely-subtle-sun-tzu.text: Be extremely subtle, even to the point of formlessness. Be extremely mysterious, even to the point of soundlessness. Thereby you can be the director of the opponent's fate.

easter-is-meant-to-b-janine-di-giovanni.author: Janine di Giovanni
easter-is-meant-to-b-janine-di-giovanni.text: Easter is meant to be a symbol of hope, renewal, and new life.

if-your-working-tele-jeff-foxworthy.author: Jeff Foxworthy
if-your-working-tele-jeff-foxworthy.text: If your working television sits on top of your non-working television, you might be a redneck.

liberty-cannot-be-pr-john-adams.author: John Adams
liberty-cannot-be-pr-john-adams.text: Liberty cannot be preserved without general knowledge among the people.

no-matter-what-peopl-robin-williams.author: Robin Williams
no-matter-what-peopl-robin-williams.text: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.

a-man-who-was-comple-mahatma-gandhi.author: Mahatma Gandhi
a-man-who-was-comple-mahatma-gandhi.text: A man who was completely innocent, offered himself as a sacrifice for the good of others, including his enemies, and became the ransom of the world. It was a perfect act.

a-rebirth-out-of-spi-james-e-faust.author: James E. Faust

do-not-abandon-yours-pope-john-paul-ii.text: Do not abandon yourselves to despair. We are the Easter people and hallelujah is our song.

god-had-brought-me-t-bede-griffiths.author: Bede Griffiths
god-had-brought-me-t-bede-griffiths.text: God had brought me to my knees and made me acknowledge my own nothingness, and out of that knowledge I had been reborn. I was no longer the centre of my life and therefore I could see God in everything.

god-proved-his-love-billy-graham.author: Billy Graham
god-proved-his-love-billy-graham.text: God proved His love on the Cross. When Christ hung, and bled, and died, it was God saying to the world, 'I love you.'

i-think-we-need-to-d-louie-schwartzberg.author: Louie Schwartzberg
i-think-we-need-to-d-louie-schwartzberg.text: I think we need to do some deep soul searching about what's important in our lives and renew our spirit and our spiritual thinking, whether it's through faith-based religion or just through loving nature or helping your fellow man.

it-is-difficult-to-s-robert-h-schuller.author: Robert H. Schuller
it-is-difficult-to-s-robert-h-schuller.text: It is difficult to say what is impossible, for the dream of yesterday is the hope of today and the reality of tomorrow.

last-year-i-went-fis-steven-wright.author: Steven Wright
last-year-i-went-fis-steven-wright.text: Last year I went fishing with Salvador Dali. He was using a dotted line. He caught every other fish.

let-every-man-and-wo-phillips-brooks.author: Phillips Brooks
let-every-man-and-wo-phillips-brooks.text: Let every man and woman count himself immortal. Let him catch the revelation of Jesus in his resurrection. Let him say not merely, 'Christ is risen,' but 'I shall rise.'

love-always-involves-william-barclay.author: William Barclay
love-always-involves-william-barclay.text: Love always involves responsibility, and love always involves sacrifice. And we do not really love Christ unless we are prepared to face His task and to take up His Cross.

outside-of-the-cross-ravi-zacharias.author: Ravi Zacharias
outside-of-the-cross-ravi-zacharias.text: Outside of the cross of Jesus Christ, there is no hope in this world. That cross and resurrection at the core of the Gospel is the only hope for humanity. Wherever you go, ask God for wisdom on how to get that Gospel in, even in the toughest situations of life.

science-may-have-fou-helen-keller.author: Helen Keller
science-may-have-fou-helen-keller.text: Science may have found a cure for most evils; but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all - the apathy of human beings.

the-bible-tells-us-t-rick-warren.author: Rick Warren
the-bible-tells-us-t-rick-warren.text: The Bible tells us that Jesus Christ came to do three things. He came to have my past forgiven, you get a purpose for living and a home in Heaven.

the-great-gift-of-ea-basil-hume.author: Basil Hume

the-symbolic-languag-deepak-chopra.author: Deepak Chopra

to-a-christian-east-bernhard-langer.author: Bernhard Langer

try-to-be-like-the-t-bill-copeland.author: Bill Copeland
try-to-be-like-the-t-bill-copeland.text: Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell.

we-are-told-to-let-o-dwight-l-moody.author: Dwight L. Moody
we-are-told-to-let-o-dwight-l-moody.text: We are told to let our light shine, and if it does, we won't need to tell anybody it does. Lighthouses don't fire cannons to call attention to their shining - they just shine.

when-love-is-not-mad-pedro-calderon-de-l.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca
when-love-is-not-mad-pedro-calderon-de-l.text: When love is not madness, it is not love.

earth-day-should-enc-scott-peters.author: Scott Peters

either-i-will-find-a-philip-sidney.author: Philip Sidney
either-i-will-find-a-philip-sidney.text: Either I will find a way, or I will make one.

god-loves-each-of-us-saint-augustine.author: Saint Augustine
god-loves-each-of-us-saint-augustine.text: God loves each of us as if there were only one of us.

i-distrust-camels-a-joe-e-lewis.author: Joe E. Lewis
i-distrust-camels-a-joe-e-lewis.text: I distrust camels, and anyone else who can go a week without a drink.

it-is-better-to-know-james-thurber.author: James Thurber

on-earth-day-we-cel-john-hoeven.text: On Earth Day, we celebrate all the gifts the world and nature make available to us. We recognize our complete dependence on its bounty. And we acknowledge the need for good stewardship to preserve its fruits for future generations.

politics-is-such-a-t-thomas-jefferson.author: Thomas Jefferson

be-as-you-wish-to-se-socrates.author: Socrates

faith-is-about-trust-joel-osteen.author: Joel Osteen

i-know-that-i-am-int-socrates.author: Socrates
i-know-that-i-am-int-socrates.text: I know that I am intelligent, because I know that I know nothing.

sweet-mercy-is-nobil-william-shakespeare.author: William Shakespeare
sweet-mercy-is-nobil-william-shakespeare.text: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge.

the-constitution-onl-benjamin-franklin.author: Benjamin Franklin
the-constitution-onl-benjamin-franklin.text: The Constitution only gives people the right to pursue happiness. You have to catch it yourself.

the-sun-too-shines-diogenes.author: Diogenes

there-is-a-wisdom-of-charles-dickens.author: Charles Dickens
