there-is-only-one-va-georges-braque.author: Georges Braque

what-is-a-soul-its-ray-charles.author: Ray Charles

dont-be-afraid-to-g-shirley-mac-laine.author: Shirley MacLaine

love-does-not-consis-antoine-de-saint-ex.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

anyone-who-isnt-con-edward-r-murrow.author: Edward R. Murrow

he-that-rises-late-m-benjamin-franklin.text: He that rises late must trot all day.

love-is-a-gross-exag-george-bernard-shaw.author: George Bernard Shaw

nobody-who-ever-gave-george-halas.author: George Halas
nobody-who-ever-gave-george-halas.text: Nobody who ever gave his best regretted it.

ten-people-who-speak-napoleon-bonaparte.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

the-internet-is-a-gr-bob-dole.author: Bob Dole

you-cant-wait-for-i-jack-london.author: Jack London

art-is-the-objectifi-herman-melville.author: Herman Melville

if-youre-listening-alice-cooper.author: Alice Cooper

jesus-is-ideal-and-w-mahatma-gandhi.author: Mahatma Gandhi

history-never-looks-john-w-gardner.text: History never looks like history when you are living through it.

i-am-only-one-but-i-edward-everett-hale.text: I am only one, but I am one. I cannot do everything, but I can do something. And I will not let what I cannot do interfere with what I can do.

problems-are-not-the-virginia-satir.text: Problems are not the problem; coping is the problem.

reading-is-to-the-mi-joseph-addison.author: Joseph Addison
reading-is-to-the-mi-joseph-addison.text: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.

some-people-drink-fr-robert-anthony.author: Robert Anthony

the-supernatural-is-elbert-hubbard.text: The supernatural is the natural not yet understood.

when-i-pray-coincid-william-temple.author: William Temple
when-i-pray-coincid-william-temple.text: When I pray, coincidences happen, and when I don't, they don't.

your-own-mind-is-a-s-arnold-bennett.author: Arnold Bennett
your-own-mind-is-a-s-arnold-bennett.text: Your own mind is a sacred enclosure into which nothing harmful can enter except by your permission.

i-grew-up-in-a-small-kate-bosworth.text: I grew up in a small town where everyone wanted to be the same or look the same and was afraid to be different.

what-would-life-be-i-vincent-van-gogh.author: Vincent Van Gogh
what-would-life-be-i-vincent-van-gogh.text: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?

as-human-beings-we-bernard-sumner.text: As human beings, we all mature physically from childhood to adolescence and then into adulthood, but our emotions lag behind.

camp-is-a-vision-o-susan-sontag.text: 'Camp' is a vision of the world in terms of style - but a particular style. It is the love of the exaggerated.

i-think-children-are-kelly-ripa.author: Kelly Ripa

if-evolution-really-milton-berle.author: Milton Berle
if-evolution-really-milton-berle.text: If evolution really works, how come mothers only have two hands?

if-your-knees-arent-bill-watterson.author: Bill Watterson

it-is-amazing-what-y-harry-s-truman.author: Harry S Truman

motherhood-all-love-robert-browning.text: Motherhood: All love begins and ends there.

a-good-teacher-is-a-gilbert-highet.author: Gilbert Highet
a-good-teacher-is-a-gilbert-highet.text: A good teacher is a determined person.

for-every-moment-of-hunter-s-thompson.author: Hunter S. Thompson
for-every-moment-of-hunter-s-thompson.text: For every moment of triumph, for every instance of beauty, many souls must be trampled.

let-your-tongue-spea-davy-crockett.author: Davy Crockett
let-your-tongue-spea-davy-crockett.text: Let your tongue speak what your heart thinks.

love-is-friendship-s-jeremy-taylor.author: Jeremy Taylor
love-is-friendship-s-jeremy-taylor.text: Love is friendship set on fire.

a-lot-of-people-are-steven-wright.author: Steven Wright
a-lot-of-people-are-steven-wright.text: A lot of people are afraid of heights. Not me, I'm afraid of widths.

an-effort-made-for-t-lydia-m-child.author: Lydia M. Child
an-effort-made-for-t-lydia-m-child.text: An effort made for the happiness of others lifts above ourselves.

glory-is-fleeting-b-napoleon-bonaparte.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

he-who-angers-you-co-elizabeth-kenny.text: He who angers you conquers you.

a-mothers-happiness-honore-de-balzac.author: Honore de Balzac
a-mothers-happiness-honore-de-balzac.text: A mother's happiness is like a beacon, lighting up the future but reflected also on the past in the guise of fond memories.

all-that-i-am-or-ho-abraham-lincoln.author: Abraham Lincoln
all-that-i-am-or-ho-abraham-lincoln.text: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.

forget-bottled-water-ashlan-gorse-couste.author: Ashlan Gorse Cousteau
forget-bottled-water-ashlan-gorse-couste.text: Forget bottled water; tap water is just as good! Pour it into a reusable water bottle, and always have fresh water on the go without wasting plastic.

mothers-love-is-pea-erich-fromm.author: Erich Fromm
mothers-love-is-pea-erich-fromm.text: Mother's love is peace. It need not be acquired, it need not be deserved.

punctuality-is-the-v-evelyn-waugh.author: Evelyn Waugh
punctuality-is-the-v-evelyn-waugh.text: Punctuality is the virtue of the bored.

children-are-the-anc-sophocles.text: Children are the anchors that hold a mother to life.

for-when-a-child-is-gilbert-parker.text: For when a child is born the mother also is born again.

i-knew-doris-day-bef-oscar-levant.author: Oscar Levant
i-knew-doris-day-bef-oscar-levant.text: I knew Doris Day before she was a virgin.

i-like-joy-i-want-t-doris-day.author: Doris Day
i-like-joy-i-want-t-doris-day.text: I like joy; I want to be joyous; I want to have fun on the set; I want to wear beautiful clothes and look pretty. I want to smile, and I want to make people laugh. And that's all I want. I like it. I like being happy. I want to make others happy.

mom-is-the-most-unco-rashida-jones.author: Rashida Jones
mom-is-the-most-unco-rashida-jones.text: Mom is the most unconditionally loving person I will ever know, and she has always supported me on every level.

motherhood-is-a-grea-charles-stanley.author: Charles Stanley
motherhood-is-a-grea-charles-stanley.text: Motherhood is a great honor and privilege, yet it is also synonymous with servanthood. Every day women are called upon to selflessly meet the needs of their families. Whether they are awake at night nursing a baby, spending their time and money on less-than-grateful teenagers, or preparing meals, moms continuously put others before themselves.

my-mom-is-definitely-alicia-keys.author: Alicia Keys
my-mom-is-definitely-alicia-keys.text: My mom is definitely my rock.

my-mother-is-a-walki-leonardo-di-caprio.author: Leonardo DiCaprio
my-mother-is-a-walki-leonardo-di-caprio.text: My mother is a walking miracle.

sometimes-the-streng-barbara-kingsolver.author: Barbara Kingsolver
sometimes-the-streng-barbara-kingsolver.text: Sometimes the strength of motherhood is greater than natural laws.

the-best-way-to-keep-napoleon-bonaparte.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
the-best-way-to-keep-napoleon-bonaparte.text: The best way to keep one's word is not to give it.

the-natural-state-of-jessica-lange.author: Jessica Lange
the-natural-state-of-jessica-lange.text: The natural state of motherhood is unselfishness. When you become a mother, you are no longer the center of your own universe. You relinquish that position to your children.

there-is-a-woman-at-alphonse-de-lamartin.author: Alphonse de Lamartine
there-is-a-woman-at-alphonse-de-lamartin.text: There is a woman at the begining of all great things.

when-you-are-a-mothe-sophia-loren.author: Sophia Loren
when-you-are-a-mothe-sophia-loren.text: When you are a mother, you are never really alone in your thoughts. A mother always has to think twice, once for herself and once for her child.

when-your-mother-ask-erma-bombeck.author: Erma Bombeck
when-your-mother-ask-erma-bombeck.text: When your mother asks, 'Do you want a piece of advice?' it is a mere formality. It doesn't matter if you answer yes or no. You're going to get it anyway.

whos-a-boy-gonna-ta-donald-e-westlake.author: Donald E. Westlake
whos-a-boy-gonna-ta-donald-e-westlake.text: Who's a boy gonna talk to if not his mother?

gratitude-is-riches-doris-day.author: Doris Day
gratitude-is-riches-doris-day.text: Gratitude is riches. Complaint is poverty.

i-got-to-grow-up-wit-antonio-villaraigos.author: Antonio Villaraigosa
i-got-to-grow-up-wit-antonio-villaraigos.text: I got to grow up with a mother who taught me to believe in me.

if-you-do-not-think-john-galsworthy.author: John Galsworthy
if-you-do-not-think-john-galsworthy.text: If you do not think about your future, you cannot have one.

ive-never-met-an-an-doris-day.author: Doris Day
ive-never-met-an-an-doris-day.text: I've never met an animal I didn't like, and I can't say the same thing about people.

mother-is-the-name-f-william-makepeace-t.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
mother-is-the-name-f-william-makepeace-t.text: Mother is the name for God in the lips and hearts of little children.

real-happiness-is-ch-hosea-ballou.author: Hosea Ballou
real-happiness-is-ch-hosea-ballou.text: Real happiness is cheap enough, yet how dearly we pay for its counterfeit.

until-you-value-your-m-scott-peck.author: M. Scott Peck
until-you-value-your-m-scott-peck.text: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you will not do anything with it.

a-good-garden-may-ha-thomas-fuller.author: Thomas Fuller
a-good-garden-may-ha-thomas-fuller.text: A good garden may have some weeds.

freedom-is-what-you-jean-paul-sartre.author: Jean-Paul Sartre
freedom-is-what-you-jean-paul-sartre.text: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.

have-patience-all-t-saadi.author: Saadi
have-patience-all-t-saadi.text: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.

i-think-its-importa-paula-cole.author: Paula Cole
i-think-its-importa-paula-cole.text: I think it's important to find the little things in everyday life that make you happy.

if-a-man-devotes-him-albrecht-durer.author: Albrecht Durer
if-a-man-devotes-him-albrecht-durer.text: If a man devotes himself to art, much evil is avoided that happens otherwise if one is idle.

if-youre-so-pro-lif-bill-hicks.author: Bill Hicks
if-youre-so-pro-lif-bill-hicks.text: If you're so pro-life, do me a favour: don't lock arms and block medical clinics. If you're so pro-life, lock arms and block cemeteries.

it-is-not-the-mounta-edmund-hillary.author: Edmund Hillary
it-is-not-the-mounta-edmund-hillary.text: It is not the mountain we conquer but ourselves.

silence-is-the-sleep-francis-bacon.author: Francis Bacon
silence-is-the-sleep-francis-bacon.text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.

the-emphasis-must-be-ruth-bader-ginsburg.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
the-emphasis-must-be-ruth-bader-ginsburg.text: The emphasis must be not on the right to abortion but on the right to privacy and reproductive control.

there-are-still-forc-john-lewis.author: John Lewis
there-are-still-forc-john-lewis.text: There are still forces in America that want to divide us along racial lines, religious lines, sex, class. But we've come too far; we've made too much progress to stop or to pull back. We must go forward. And I believe we will get there.

to-jaw-jaw-is-always-winston-churchill.author: Winston Churchill
to-jaw-jaw-is-always-winston-churchill.text: To jaw-jaw is always better than to war-war.

well-i-do-find-the-b-doris-day.author: Doris Day
well-i-do-find-the-b-doris-day.text: Well I do find the beauty in animals. I find beauty everywhere. I find beauty in my garden.

when-i-get-a-little-desiderius-erasmus.author: Desiderius Erasmus
when-i-get-a-little-desiderius-erasmus.text: When I get a little money I buy books; and if any is left I buy food and clothes.

words-make-you-think-e-y-harburg.author: E. Y. Harburg
words-make-you-think-e-y-harburg.text: Words make you think a thought. Music makes you feel a feeling. A song makes you feel a thought.

a-lie-told-often-eno-vladimir-lenin.author: Vladimir Lenin
a-lie-told-often-eno-vladimir-lenin.text: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.

a-team-is-where-a-bo-mickey-mantle.author: Mickey Mantle
a-team-is-where-a-bo-mickey-mantle.text: A team is where a boy can prove his courage on his own. A gang is where a coward goes to hide.

architecture-is-the-philip-johnson.author: Philip Johnson
architecture-is-the-philip-johnson.text: Architecture is the art of how to waste space.

art-is-not-a-study-o-john-ruskin.author: John Ruskin
art-is-not-a-study-o-john-ruskin.text: Art is not a study of positive reality, it is the seeking for ideal truth.

comedy-can-be-a-cath-robin-williams.author: Robin Williams
comedy-can-be-a-cath-robin-williams.text: Comedy can be a cathartic way to deal with personal trauma.

courage-is-fire-and-benjamin-disraeli.author: Benjamin Disraeli
courage-is-fire-and-benjamin-disraeli.text: Courage is fire, and bullying is smoke.

fear-is-the-mother-o-thomas-hardy.author: Thomas Hardy
fear-is-the-mother-o-thomas-hardy.text: Fear is the mother of foresight.

god-is-bigger-than-p-jimmy-dean.author: Jimmy Dean
god-is-bigger-than-p-jimmy-dean.text: God is bigger than people think.

history-has-taught-u-tim-pawlenty.author: Tim Pawlenty
history-has-taught-u-tim-pawlenty.text: History has taught us over and over again that freedom is not free. When push comes to shove, the ultimate protectors of freedom and liberty are the brave men and women in our armed forces. Throughout our history, they've answered the call in bravery and sacrifice.

if-we-only-wanted-to-montesquieu.author: Montesquieu
if-we-only-wanted-to-montesquieu.text: If we only wanted to be happy, it would be easy; but we want to be happier than other people, and that is almost always difficult, since we think them happier than they are.

if-you-ask-me-anythi-yogi-berra.author: Yogi Berra
if-you-ask-me-anythi-yogi-berra.text: If you ask me anything I don't know, I'm not going to answer.

it-is-impossible-to-francis-bacon.author: Francis Bacon
it-is-impossible-to-francis-bacon.text: It is impossible to love and to be wise.

nothing-can-be-done-charles-baudelaire.author: Charles Baudelaire
nothing-can-be-done-charles-baudelaire.text: Nothing can be done except little by little.

opera-in-english-is-h-l-mencken.author: H. L. Mencken
opera-in-english-is-h-l-mencken.text: Opera in English is, in the main, just about as sensible as baseball in Italian.

remember-upon-the-co-alexander-the-great.author: Alexander the Great
remember-upon-the-co-alexander-the-great.text: Remember upon the conduct of each depends the fate of all.

ten-soldiers-wisely-euripides.author: Euripides
ten-soldiers-wisely-euripides.text: Ten soldiers wisely led will beat a hundred without a head.

the-passage-of-the-c-aberjhani.author: Aberjhani
the-passage-of-the-c-aberjhani.text: The passage of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 represented precisely such a hope - that America had learned from its past and acted to secure a better tomorrow.

we-will-never-see-a-ruth-bader-ginsburg.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
we-will-never-see-a-ruth-bader-ginsburg.text: We will never see a day when women of means are not able to get a safe abortion in this country.

you-can-lead-a-man-t-milton-berle.author: Milton Berle
you-can-lead-a-man-t-milton-berle.text: You can lead a man to Congress, but you can't make him think.

memorial-day-this-ye-robin-hayes.author: Robin Hayes
memorial-day-this-ye-robin-hayes.text: Memorial Day this year is especially important as we are reminded almost daily of the great sacrifices that the men and women of the Armed Services make to defend our way of life.

rough-diamonds-may-s-thomas-browne.author: Thomas Browne
rough-diamonds-may-s-thomas-browne.text: Rough diamonds may sometimes be mistaken for worthless pebbles.

the-foot-feels-the-f-buddha.author: Buddha
the-foot-feels-the-f-buddha.text: The foot feels the foot when it feels the ground.

the-most-basic-quest-thomas-sowell.author: Thomas Sowell
the-most-basic-quest-thomas-sowell.text: The most basic question is not what is best, but who shall decide what is best.

we-are-all-gifted-t-ethel-waters.author: Ethel Waters
we-are-all-gifted-t-ethel-waters.text: We are all gifted. That is our inheritance.

when-a-man-opens-a-c-prince-philip.author: Prince Philip
when-a-man-opens-a-c-prince-philip.text: When a man opens a car door for his wife, it's either a new car or a new wife.

137-years-later-mem-doc-hastings.author: Doc Hastings
137-years-later-mem-doc-hastings.text: 137 years later, Memorial Day remains one of America's most cherished patriotic observances. The spirit of this day has not changed - it remains a day to honor those who died defending our freedom and democracy.

as-america-celebrate-john-m-mc-hugh.author: John M. McHugh
as-america-celebrate-john-m-mc-hugh.text: As America celebrates Memorial Day, we pay tribute to those who have given their lives in our nation's wars.

challenging-the-mean-viktor-e-frankl.author: Viktor E. Frankl
challenging-the-mean-viktor-e-frankl.text: Challenging the meaning of life is the truest expression of the state of being human.

how-far-that-little-william-shakespeare.author: William Shakespeare
how-far-that-little-william-shakespeare.text: How far that little candle throws its beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.

i-never-guess-it-is-arthur-conan-doyle.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
i-never-guess-it-is-arthur-conan-doyle.text: I never guess. It is a shocking habit destructive to the logical faculty.

i-think-its-the-hum-amanda-lindhout.author: Amanda Lindhout
i-think-its-the-hum-amanda-lindhout.text: I think it's the human spirit inside of all of us that has an enormous capacity to survive.

i-went-to-a-catholic-camille-guaty.author: Camille Guaty
i-went-to-a-catholic-camille-guaty.text: I went to a Catholic school, so of course we had to wear uniforms. My only form of expression was in shoes and the style of my hair.

im-mickey-mouse-th-keanu-reeves.author: Keanu Reeves
im-mickey-mouse-th-keanu-reeves.text: I'm Mickey Mouse. They don't know who's inside the suit.

its-easy-to-make-a-tom-brokaw.author: Tom Brokaw
its-easy-to-make-a-tom-brokaw.text: It's easy to make a buck. It's a lot tougher to make a difference.

judge-a-man-by-his-q-voltaire.author: Voltaire
judge-a-man-by-his-q-voltaire.text: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.

keep-a-cool-head-and-deng-xiaoping.author: Deng Xiaoping
keep-a-cool-head-and-deng-xiaoping.text: Keep a cool head and maintain a low profile. Never take the lead - but aim to do something big.

memorial-day-isnt-j-pete-hegseth.author: Pete Hegseth
memorial-day-isnt-j-pete-hegseth.text: Memorial Day isn't just about honoring veterans, its honoring those who lost their lives. Veterans had the fortune of coming home. For us, that's a reminder of when we come home we still have a responsibility to serve. It's a continuation of service that honors our country and those who fell defending it.

the-willingness-of-a-jeff-miller.author: Jeff Miller
the-willingness-of-a-jeff-miller.text: The willingness of America's veterans to sacrifice for our country has earned them our lasting gratitude.

time-is-but-the-stre-henry-david-thoreau.author: Henry David Thoreau
time-is-but-the-stre-henry-david-thoreau.text: Time is but the stream I go a-fishing in.

what-is-love-it-is-sinclair-lewis.author: Sinclair Lewis
what-is-love-it-is-sinclair-lewis.text: What is love? It is the morning and the evening star.

when-im-ready-to-fi-mr-t.author: Mr. T
when-im-ready-to-fi-mr-t.text: When I'm ready to fight, my opponent has a better chance of surviving a forest fire wearing gasoline drawers.

when-in-doubt-tell-t-mark-twain.author: Mark Twain
when-in-doubt-tell-t-mark-twain.text: When in doubt tell the truth.

yield-to-temptation-robert-a-heinlein.author: Robert A. Heinlein
yield-to-temptation-robert-a-heinlein.text: Yield to temptation. It may not pass your way again.

there-is-nothing-nob-nick-lampson.author: Nick Lampson
there-is-nothing-nob-nick-lampson.text: There is nothing nobler than risking your life for your country.

without-craftsmanshi-johannes-brahms.author: Johannes Brahms
without-craftsmanshi-johannes-brahms.text: Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.

a-mans-country-is-n-george-william-curti.author: George William Curtis
a-mans-country-is-n-george-william-curti.text: A man's country is not a certain area of land, of mountains, rivers, and woods, but it is a principle and patriotism is loyalty to that principle.

america-is-hope-it-paul-tsongas.author: Paul Tsongas
america-is-hope-it-paul-tsongas.text: America is hope. It is compassion. It is excellence. It is valor.

appearances-are-a-gl-anaxagoras.author: Anaxagoras
appearances-are-a-gl-anaxagoras.text: Appearances are a glimpse of the unseen.

courage-is-fear-hold-george-s-patton.author: George S. Patton
courage-is-fear-hold-george-s-patton.text: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.

it-is-foolish-and-wr-george-s-patton.author: George S. Patton
it-is-foolish-and-wr-george-s-patton.text: It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died. Rather we should thank God that such men lived.

it-is-love-not-reas-thomas-mann.author: Thomas Mann
it-is-love-not-reas-thomas-mann.text: It is love, not reason, that is stronger than death.

on-memorial-day-i-d-eric-burdon.author: Eric Burdon
on-memorial-day-i-d-eric-burdon.text: On Memorial Day, I don't want to only remember the combatants. There were also those who came out of the trenches as writers and poets, who started preaching peace, men and women who have made this world a kinder place to live.

over-all-our-happy-c-will-carleton.author: Will Carleton
over-all-our-happy-c-will-carleton.text: Over all our happy country - over all our Nation spread, Is a band of noble heroes - is our Army of the Dead.

patriotism-consists-james-bryce.author: James Bryce
patriotism-consists-james-bryce.text: Patriotism consists not in waving the flag, but in striving that our country shall be righteous as well as strong.

the-patriots-blood-thomas-campbell.author: Thomas Campbell
the-patriots-blood-thomas-campbell.text: The patriot's blood is the seed of Freedom's tree.

the-purpose-of-all-w-saint-augustine.author: Saint Augustine
the-purpose-of-all-w-saint-augustine.text: The purpose of all wars, is peace.

these-fallen-heroes-michael-n-castle.author: Michael N. Castle
these-fallen-heroes-michael-n-castle.text: These fallen heroes represent the character of a nation who has a long history of patriotism and honor - and a nation who has fought many battles to keep our country free from threats of terror.

time-and-memory-are-john-dewey.author: John Dewey
time-and-memory-are-john-dewey.text: Time and memory are true artists; they remould reality nearer to the heart's desire.

it-is-an-ironic-habi-rollo-may.author: Rollo May
it-is-an-ironic-habi-rollo-may.text: It is an ironic habit of human beings to run faster when we have lost our way.

my-fellow-americans-john-f-kennedy.author: John F. Kennedy
my-fellow-americans-john-f-kennedy.text: My fellow Americans, ask not what your country can do for you, ask what you can do for your country.

my-motto-is-content-charles-lamb.author: Charles Lamb
my-motto-is-content-charles-lamb.text: My motto is: Contented with little, yet wishing for more.

a-friend-in-power-is-henry-adams.author: Henry Adams
a-friend-in-power-is-henry-adams.text: A friend in power is a friend lost.

a-pair-of-powerful-s-friedrich-nietzsche.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
a-pair-of-powerful-s-friedrich-nietzsche.text: A pair of powerful spectacles has sometimes sufficed to cure a person in love.

be-thankful-were-no-will-rogers.author: Will Rogers
be-thankful-were-no-will-rogers.text: Be thankful we're not getting all the government we're paying for.

ceremonies-are-impor-jennifer-granholm.author: Jennifer Granholm
ceremonies-are-impor-jennifer-granholm.text: Ceremonies are important. But our gratitude has to be more than visits to the troops, and once-a-year Memorial Day ceremonies. We honor the dead best by treating the living well.

dont-pray-when-it-r-satchel-paige.author: Satchel Paige
dont-pray-when-it-r-satchel-paige.text: Don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.

give-light-and-peopl-ella-baker.author: Ella Baker
give-light-and-peopl-ella-baker.text: Give light and people will find the way.

not-everybody-trusts-ansel-adams.author: Ansel Adams
not-everybody-trusts-ansel-adams.text: Not everybody trusts paintings but people believe photographs.

one-could-not-pluck-loren-eiseley.author: Loren Eiseley
one-could-not-pluck-loren-eiseley.text: One could not pluck a flower without troubling a star.

optimism-is-the-foun-nicholas-m-butler.author: Nicholas M. Butler
optimism-is-the-foun-nicholas-m-butler.text: Optimism is the foundation of courage.

people-arent-born-s-christina-grimmie.author: Christina Grimmie
people-arent-born-s-christina-grimmie.text: People aren't born strong. People grow stronger little by little, encountering difficult situations, learning not to run from them.

reach-for-it-push-y-christa-mc-auliffe.author: Christa McAuliffe
reach-for-it-push-y-christa-mc-auliffe.text: Reach for it. Push yourself as far as you can.

the-savage-in-man-is-henry-david-thoreau.author: Henry David Thoreau
the-savage-in-man-is-henry-david-thoreau.text: The savage in man is never quite eradicated.

there-are-thoughts-w-victor-hugo.author: Victor Hugo
there-are-thoughts-w-victor-hugo.text: There are thoughts which are prayers. There are moments when, whatever the posture of the body, the soul is on its knees.

gratitude-is-the-fai-henry-ward-beecher.author: Henry Ward Beecher
gratitude-is-the-fai-henry-ward-beecher.text: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.

people-tend-to-treat-zach-anner.author: Zach Anner
people-tend-to-treat-zach-anner.text: People tend to treat people with disabilities sort of like they're aliens from another planet. It doesn't come from a bad place; it comes from a place of, 'I have no idea what this disability entails, and I don't want to offend anyone or make them feel awful.'

she-got-her-looks-fr-groucho-marx.author: Groucho Marx
she-got-her-looks-fr-groucho-marx.text: She got her looks from her father. He's a plastic surgeon.

slavery-takes-hold-o-lucius-annaeus-sene.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
slavery-takes-hold-o-lucius-annaeus-sene.text: Slavery takes hold of few, but many take hold of slavery.

be-not-simply-good-henry-david-thoreau.author: Henry David Thoreau
be-not-simply-good-henry-david-thoreau.text: Be not simply good - be good for something.

i-am-two-fools-i-kn-john-donne.author: John Donne
i-am-two-fools-i-kn-john-donne.text: I am two fools, I know, for loving, and for saying so in whining poetry.

to-me-every-hour-of-walt-whitman.author: Walt Whitman
to-me-every-hour-of-walt-whitman.text: To me, every hour of the day and night is an unspeakably perfect miracle.

will-and-i-are-yin-a-jada-pinkett-smith.author: Jada Pinkett Smith
will-and-i-are-yin-a-jada-pinkett-smith.text: Will and I are yin and yang. He's all sky, vast and bright and soaring, and I'm all earth. I'm here to ground him, and he's here to help me fly.

words-are-but-pictur-john-dryden.author: John Dryden
words-are-but-pictur-john-dryden.text: Words are but pictures of our thoughts.
